data.title: Thunderbirds (1985 Video Game)
data.meta_description: Thunderbirds was the only title of a 1985 video game published by Firebird Software. data.text:
Thunderbirds was the only title of a 1985 video game published by Firebird Software. It was released on the Commodore 64 and ZX Spectrum and notably marked the first ever Thunderbirds video game.

Plot[]

[Taken from the back cover]

A team of Egyptologists are trapped in the ancient tomb of Tootnmoughtin. Heavy stone blocks and a highly complex maze bar their exit. Running out of air they transmit one final message. Somewhere in Earth's orbit Thunderbird Five records their desperate S.O.S. — suddenly, THUNDERBIRDS ARE GO!

Gameplay[]

Gameplay was relatively simple, with the player controlling Thunderbird 1 and Thunderbird 2[1] as they navigated screens of mazes. Various obstacles hampered their progress, including massive vines and variously shaped coloured blocks which could be pushed out of the way or lifted up by the vehicles. Blue blocks could only be moved by TB1 and green blocks by TB2, with red blocks able to be moved by either. Some screens also featured decreased light levels making navigation more difficult while others featured shuriken-like projectiles which damaged the Thunderbirds.

Each piece of treasure collected by the player was worth 100 points.

The enemies consisted of mummies, jackal-like beings reminiscent of Anubis, and spiders. They were often present in locations which did not require a close encounter if the player had brought certain equipment with them.

Equipment[]

"YOU START YOUR MISSION WITH 4000 POINTS AND NO CARGO.

THUNDERBIRD TWO CAN CARRY UP TO 40 TONS OF EQUIPMENT IN IT'S [sic] HOLD.

EACH TON CARRIED WILL LOSE 100 POINTS FROM YOUR STARTING SCORE.

EXPERIENCED PLAYERS MAY CHOOSE NOT TO CARRY ANY EQUIPMENT, BUT KEEPING THE POINTS — MAKING THIS SIMULATION MORE DIFFICULT."

Weedkiller: 5 tons

Heavy duty acid: 5 tons

Emergency transport: 5 tons

Thunderbird 4: 15 tons

Guided missiles: 5 tons

Acme cave sonar: 10 tons

Bulldozer: 15 tons

The Mole: 15 tons

Earthquake bomb: 15 tons

Extra fuel: 5 tons

Trivia[]

Thunderbird 2 does not use its ramp to launch from Tracy Island, instead taking off vertically from a standing position.

The Commodore 64 version of the game featured several colour differences to its ZX Spectrum counterpart, most notably to the landscape and Thunderbird 1.
